website_summaries.verdict: If your budget comes first when considering a track saw, this is a good choice. But if you have dense wood to cut or other major tasks, we recommend a more powerful tool.
pros: Comes with a dust port to keep clean-up to a minimum
Good for users new to this type of machinery or for small to mid-level tasks
cons: Not for extremely heavy-duty tasks due to the 9 amp motor that is under-powered compared to some of its competitors

customer_reviews.title: For the money, it's a nice track saw.
customer_reviews.text: As many others have said, it rocks side to side on the track. I went ahead and purchased another piece of glide strip from Dewalt to take care of the issue but I haven't installed it yet. I expect the saw to be solid after the "fix"... but this should not be a required step. If they fixed this issue, it would be a very nice saw. I also agree with the others who said the spring is too stiff. When making very long cuts (where you have to stretch out) it's hard to keep the saw down (plunged). I saw where another user replaced the spring, but I am not sure if I will go there or not yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Too bad the manufacturer hasn't made them since it would probably ...
customer_reviews.text: As stated in the track review there are some well known "fixes" to bring the saw and track up to a higher level of performance suitable for the quality of work a track saw is used for. Too bad the manufacturer hasn't made them since it would probably cost them little or nothing. Anyway once the tweaks are done the saw works good and can be used as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money. This is worthless
customer_reviews.text: This product is way under powered, won’t cut straight. even with the track clamped down it pulls to the right terribly bad ruining a whole sheet of melamine. 20 inches into the cut it bogs down, even if you stop moving, and starts smoking. It’s complete piece of crap and a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: The motor is undersized and the blade is very poor. My track had a bow in it and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have the equivalent product in a Hitachi at home. Needed a saw todo some light projects at my daughters house. Took a chance on this. It was a mistake This is a pale imitation. The motor is undersized and the blade is very poor. My track had a bow in it and wouldn't cut a straight line without being clamped down (something I don't have to do with Hitachi). Can't recommend this for even the most easiest of jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Week Motor
customer_reviews.text: Great for 3/4 and below, if you do a bias cut a 45 on 3/4 will tax the motor as it is a 1 1/4 inch thick cut then and the motor is not designed for that heavy of use. But below 3/4 cuts fast accurate and with no kick back.
customer_reviews.author: purplearrow

customer_reviews.title: I Use it to rip sheet goods on a regular basis
customer_reviews.text: This saw is great. Keeps 80-90 percent of saw dust in my shop vacuum. Accurate and stable . Read the directions. Yes, more than once. Change the blade to the Freud blade and use the other one for what ever you'd like. It's junk. Hence the 4 stars. But even after the Freud blade cost, you will be throwing away money to do the very same thing buying another brand. This so I handles it but it's all about the blade and proper set up. Read the instructions. Don't watch a video on YouTube and think you know how to use the saw
customer_reviews.author: HammerNNails

customer_reviews.title: Fox W1835 Track Saw
customer_reviews.text: Had done a lot of checking and for the price what the Shop Fox W1835 Track Saw has and can do is great. I hope to do many things with this saw and will ,be looking at other Fox power tools. I don't think there is a better power saw for the price I paid $192.00 total. all were much more that I came across. Set up is easy to adjust. Hope all you find or come across it will really look it over and think hard when buying a 10 inch power saw.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Polzak

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been able to really find any issues with this saw. I replaced the blade, other than that, no problems. If you cant push the saw down for plunge cuts maybe eat some wheaties...
customer_reviews.author: Eric Mason

customer_reviews.title: Directly Replaces the Grizzly Varient
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old Grizzly track saw. It fits perfectly on the tracks that I already have, which was really nice as I have well over 300$ of track already. It cuts well, is easy to set up, and honestly is the best value for a track saw.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S.

customer_reviews.title: Akward saw to get used to.
customer_reviews.text: This saw still throws a lot of sawdust out in front of the blade even though I had it hooked to a Fein vacuum. Handle is uncomfortable to grip while starting the saw and trying to release the plunge lock. Still trying to get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill V

customer_reviews.title: Great value but Amazon shouldn't describe these as new units
customer_reviews.text: This item was clearly used before it was re-sold. Sawdust and smudges all over the unit. I needed it for a project that day and for $130 I couldn't complain. The saw itself worked well with the D4362 track (sold separately and see my review there for some significant caveats). Surprising to get used stuff sold as new on Amazon, but at these prices Shop Fox and other low-end brands bring huge value to those hobbyists just starting out in woodworking. If you're going to depend on these tools for a living, look elsewhere for quality and a trouble-free ownership experience.
customer_reviews.author: EDouble

customer_reviews.title: Great saw and superb performance.  Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Super pleased with this tool. Cuts are super straight and saw is easy to use. Track has its minor issues, but not related to the saw. I have used it on some impotant project finishes and am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: IvHammer

customer_reviews.title: It is an OK saw for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad little saw but does feel a bit under powered and I was only cutting through masonite doors. For the money not bad and did make the 20 doors I had to hang go a little easier.
customer_reviews.author: Bob CF

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves it. He took it out from under the tree early just to make a gift for Christmas for our girls.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Nice clean cut-can't believed I wait so long to get ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived safely and well packaged- Used it to cut down some 3/4 plywood, Nice clean cut-can't believed I wait so long to get one of these
customer_reviews.author: Doug Dalme

customer_reviews.title: Great time saver!
customer_reviews.text: Used this saw to install laminate flooring. Worked great for making straight cuts. I would recommend this saw!
customer_reviews.author: B Donz

customer_reviews.title: Great Track Saw for the Price
customer_reviews.text: 1/2 the cost the the competitor track saws, and it's 99% the same saw. Oh ya and works great, if you hook up a shop vac you get 95% of the dust, unlike a circ saw. If you want to break down 4x8 sheets of plywood length wise get 2 of the tracks and the connection kit.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J Smith

customer_reviews.title: The saw works good but
customer_reviews.text: The saw works good but the edge of the cut is left quite rough so I purchased an different blade (see below). Which was another $50 bucks I had to spend. The Freud blade makes the saw a better saw. I guess I would have preferred spending a little more upfront for a better blade which would have made me a happier, more satisfied customer. Freud 160mm 48 Tooth Thin Kerf Plywood and Melamine Track Saw Blade with 20mm Arbor (LU79R006M20)
customer_reviews.author: AJH

customer_reviews.title: At my level of experience it works great. When you gain more experience you may want ...
customer_reviews.text: First track saw I have owned. At my level of experience it works great. When you gain more experience you may want to upgrade to a more expensive model but with a premium blade this one would be hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: John Foy

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I thought it would be. Cuts really good
customer_reviews.author: Dave w

customer_reviews.title: Went to rip a 1/8" edge off a 2x8 and it bogged so bad the blade completely stopped spinning
customer_reviews.text: Way under powered. Cut through 1/2 and 3/4 ply ok. Went to rip a 1/8" edge off a 2x8 and it bogged so bad the blade completely stopped spinning. Wasn't willing to gamble on buying a better blade for it and it still being underpowered.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Rubino

customer_reviews.title: this thing is fantastic for the price
customer_reviews.text: Hesitated for a long time because pro-reviews highlight the negatives. For a home hobbyist, this thing is fantastic for the price. They've fixed the wobble in the track that reviews of the prior version bring up. No need to remove and refix the little rubber glide. Spring tension is great. Easy one hand operation. Comes it at the same price as a nice circular saw with any of the after-market aluminum tracks/guides, but has the benefits of a purpose-built track saw.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy J Voros

customer_reviews.title: After owning it for 2 months and using it on ...
customer_reviews.text: After owning it for 2 months and using it on a few little jobs the saw quit working I'm not happy
customer_reviews.author: tiffany kelton

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my use. Clean cuts.
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my use. Clean cuts. Appears to be a pretty close copy to the more pricey saws that I can't bring myself to purchase. Much cleaner cuts than any of the shop-built guides I've made in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Andy981

customer_reviews.title: wish it had a one piece long track
customer_reviews.text: Saw works well but I wish it had a one piece long track instead of two small ones you combine.
customer_reviews.author: peter b nowikow

customer_reviews.title: I love this track saw
customer_reviews.text: I love this track saw. It gets the job done with ease and at a very affordable price in comparison to the expensive Fest-tool and Dewalt products. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Vernon Mahelona Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saw
customer_reviews.text: I built a laundry room/mud room bench/locker unit with cabinets and shelves. I did not want to buy or store a large table saw. The Shop Fox did the job WELL!
customer_reviews.author: Philip J. Cotrell

customer_reviews.title: Arrived used!
customer_reviews.text: I opened my saw today which I bought new only to find it is used. It has greasy hand prints, some sawdust and scuffs on its baseplate. I am not sure that these issues would affect use but I am concerned over why it was returned and was it looked at or refurbished. I purchased it so I could use it by the weekend. I expected a new experienced but now I am concerned. I do not know if this is how woodstock manages their items but it is frustrating. I should send it back but .... I really need it.
customer_reviews.author: John Sinnet

customer_reviews.title: nice product, nice price
customer_reviews.text: Just started using the saw and everything seems fine. I will be able to give a more detailed rating in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: barry lozier

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time the first saw went up in smoke ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time the first saw went up in smoke the second one the replacement for the first one turned out to be used, spend the extra money and buy DeWALT.
customer_reviews.author: StarDev

customer_reviews.title: SHOP FOX W1835 Track Saw
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this track saw is nice. Keep hearing that the blade is worthless. I've used it several times to rip 8' sheets of 3/4" plywood and have had NO problems. The motor seems strong and did not bog down. The only issues I have is; 1. Spring to too strong - hard to push down. Recommend replacing spring or cutting 1/4" off of it. 2. Track Saw does not fit snug on the guide rail. Recommend using UHMW 19-20A-.5-18 Tape with Acrylic Adhesive.020" Two modifications and it works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: B. Brock

customer_reviews.title: Really enjoy using my shop fox track saw
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoy using my shop fox track saw. Followed the reviews and ordered the Freud LU79R06M20 saw blade, 2 Shop Fox guide rails, and the DEWALT DWS5026 track saw clamps. I ordered one Shop Fox D4444 track connector and could not keep my Shop Fox D4362 guide rail from bowing inwards. I ordered an additional D4444 track connector. Using two of the connecting track allows me to adjust for straight line adjustment when using my two D4362 guide rails.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer1

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband for Xmas, used it once and it literally broke!!! This is a horrible product, when buying something like this you would expect to have some type of guarantee, I tried to contact the seller to see if we could exchange and ofcourse THERE ARE NO EXCHANGES!!!! We are now stick with a broken machine and worst part, NO HELP!! This is totally not right!!!!
customer_reviews.author: carol pichardo

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw after switching out factory provided blade
customer_reviews.text: Great Saw after switching out factory provided blade. But that's the case with most saws. The dust collection is good but doesn't get it all. The track system works good. I recommend this saw especially if you cut down a lot of plywood.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Merzke

product_meta.title: SHOP FOX W1835 Track Saw
product_meta.description: Shop Fox W1835 Track Saw w/ Plunge Cutting Action and True Riving Knife
feature_bullets: Blade rim speed is 9070 feet per minute
Blade size is 160mm diameter and 20mm arbor
Features 1-1/2-inch dust port for collection to a shop vacuum or dust collection system

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars76 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
